summary: Email chain from July 7, 2019, regarding attorney Martin Weinberg's difficulty accessing his client Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) after Epstein's arrest. A prosecutor from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) intervenes to verify Weinberg's standing and facilitate the attorney-client meeting before Epstein's court presentment.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested on or around July 6, 2019, and detained at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).
Epstein's attorney, Martin Weinberg, was denied access to meet with him at MCC on July 7, 2019, because Weinberg is barred in Massachusetts (out-of-state).

A prosecutor from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) intervened to verify Weinberg's standing and facilitate the attorney-client meeting before Epstein's court presentment scheduled for July 8, 2019.
The email chain highlights procedural access issues for out-of-state defense attorneys meeting with detained clients in federal custody.
The correspondence is marked as confidential and part of the SDNY document set related to the Epstein case.
